name: TheAtlantic
text: "Whether the Court will explicitly adopt an expansive definition of religious equality will have far-reaching implications for the future of free-exercise jurisprudence and how it interplays with LGBTQ rights," @ZalRothschild writes: https://t.co/Xle79W67df

name: TheAtlantic
text: Wisconsin Democratic Party chair @benwikler talks to @isaacdovere about why he's not sitting back despite the polls—and how he landed a Princess Bride reunion. https://t.co/xfg9WInxWZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The innovations of the 2010s were sufficient to convert narrow minorities of votes into big majorities of seats. But as the pro-Trump minority dwindles, the old dark arts no longer suffice," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/rDUMWOEqLe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The polls look all right for Biden. But four years ago, they looked good for Hillary Clinton too. And so, [Democrats] fear, the horror film of 2016 is getting its sequel," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/v6NIuMjB0w

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pro-Trump Latinos have one thing in common that liberals simply don't understand, @realcpaz writes. https://t.co/Oj2pya7ZMv

name: TheAtlantic
text: In his desperation to restore and showcase U.S. strength, Donald Trump has made the country weaker. @TomMcTague and @PeterAtlantic explain how Trump's America ended up alone. https://t.co/ACGxSjtVKG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At last we have a glimpse into the feelings and nature of our first lady, who has stalked through these past four years in high heels and a perfect blowout, her gaze pitiless as the sun," @CaitlinPacific writes: https://t.co/Ii1Hxr7xUZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The Postal Service's deadline for when it can guarantee delivery of a mail-in ballot has passed in most states.

For those who have yet to vote, casting a ballot in person is about as safe as going to the grocery store, @RussellBerman reported in September.https://t.co/6MXgcig8dH

name: TheAtlantic
text: Fifteen years after it first aired, @megangarber writes, "The Office" is exploding in popularity. One reason? The prescience of its worst and best character: https://t.co/zuUTZwKOm9

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Five days remain. To mark the occasion, we offer you five essential political stories. https://t.co/gess5k6cN4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I left the hospital on July 21. Three months later, I still suffer from occasional shortness of breath. I also still sometimes weep, though less frequently than in the days immediately following my discharge," @CarlosASanchez writes: https://t.co/div0AKc3R8

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump has squeezed moderates out of his party. If he wins reelection, the result will be to squeeze moderates out of American politics altogether," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/vOiaS61GKN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Even just delaying COVID-19 infections will save lives. @sarahzhang reports on falling death rates for hospitalized patients: https://t.co/4Tt7m5qyhJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: There's plenty that's going wrong for Trump. Here are four things his campaign is doing now to close the gap with Joe Biden, @PeterAtlantic reports. https://t.co/coKgIeuYC0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books by Ocean Vuong, Elizabeth Acevedo, Ben Lerner, and more bring poetic voice to works written in prose in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @cray_kate: https://t.co/Zo2anBxwCU

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Lower interest rates mean investors might need to find stability elsewhere—by broadening their portfolios. @BlackRock  https://t.co/bN3uQmYJJz https://t.co/1oCmYa6Hmm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Even if Joe Biden wins decisively next week, the coming decade could severely test America's bonds—perhaps to the greatest extent since the Civil War, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/lBv6JiUlyM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Ever since (and even before) he introduced his presidential campaign with a gilded escalator ride in 2015, Trump has been widely acknowledged as camp," @skornhaber writes, "but his reelection campaign feels like an aesthetic culmination." https://t.co/4ojL6uUKPN

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Costumes from @Netflix's The Queen’s Gambit and @TheCrownNetflix will be paired with curated objects from the Brooklyn Museum's collection and you can experience the entire exhibit online here: https://t.co/Aw81mcguL5 #TheQueenandTheCrown https://t.co/bLYGY2oYRd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @davidfrum: "America's not a democracy."

"Maybe it should be." 

https://t.co/fyRy0y1ACu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: "Our friendship tells us you can’t make assumptions.” 

A great talk with @RevDrBarber
and @wilsonhartgrove for The Friendship Files about how they became friends despite very different backgrounds, how their friendship fuels their activism and vice versa

https://t.co/x1G9TWlfEg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @cray_kate: Take a break the news with me and read some of these lovely works of fiction written by poets! https://t.co/C9NNrSTcEZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @skornhaber: Well, Trump joining the Village People sent me spiraling for a few thousand words. https://t.co/2AbvwWOadH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: .@RadioFreeTom: "Trump’s moral corruption of the Republican Party is total, from top to bottom." https://t.co/0fazIYH464

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: If Trump ekes out a clean win next week, these are the factors that will likely have delivered it for him, from @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/DAVc94f1fj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: This piece by @RonBrownstein is an excellent overview of the political forces that could assert themselves next week, and in the decade to come: https://t.co/62oVXM7gch

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @sarahzhang: Remember when everyone was trying to "flatten the curve"? It's still better to put off getting COVID-19, and we now have the data to prove it: https://t.co/LMICZQceiX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: .@skornhaber: "The sight of Trump shoulder-swiveling to 'YMCA' while entombed in his typical boxy suit sent me searching for Susan Sontag’s definitive 1964 treatise, 'Notes on ‘Camp.’” https://t.co/341ivK1G3u

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: How Trump could shock America on election night -- @PeterAtlantic lays it all out:
https://t.co/OJGeYsYZUQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: Fascinating conversation between @julieebeck, @wilsonhartgrove, and @RevDrBarber on the value of friendship among people from very different backgrounds:
https://t.co/AGyGglvYIT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Who knew in this partisan age that politicians could hold their own side to account? @helenlewis explains: https://t.co/VgntlPU5yd
